messages.message:
*NEW CODING AGENT: Jules* https://jules.google.com/
Jules is a coding agent that Google unveiled last week at IO. It is just like Devin.
For my test, I had it fix a vulnerability. It connects to Github, makes necessary changes and creates a branch. In my case, it updated the deps.bzl and go.mod, regenerated go.sum file.
All the changes happen in a VM, so you donâ€™t have to be around. Took about 1hr end-to-end.
PR committed by Jules https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/70942

This is better than the tool I built, at least for fixing the vulnerability and creating PRs. Can you maybe document the steps to run this? This should be productionzed for us. :slightly_smiling_face:

It is really simple to use. Open Jules, connect Instabase github repo and describe the task.
In my example, I copied the JIRA ticket contents - that was good enough :slightly_smiling_face:
Nice! I wonder how well it will work with non-master branches - 24.07, for example.
It does have a branch selector. At the start, you select which branch jules will work on - I chose master above.

it seems that Jules already omits content from private github repos, which has been the main legal struggle so far with Devin?

so it seems we should just use Jules, and no need to bother with Devin anymore? :sweat_smile:

we can get ashish's input when he's back from OOO
